newsitem.title: ITALY: Italian rail chief under investigation over crash.
newsitem.headline: Italian rail chief under investigation over crash.

text.p: The managing director of Italy's state railway, Giancarlo Cimoli, said on Tuesday magistrates had informed him he was under investigation following a high-speed train derailment in which eight people were killed.
Cimoli issued a statement pledging full cooperation with the enquiries after Italian news agency reports that he was among four people who had been formally notified of an investigation.
The prosecutors' office in the northern city of Piacenza confirmed that several people had been advised they faced investigation but would neither disclose the names nor the suspected offences.
The investigation followed the derailment on January 12 of a "pendolino" high-speed train as it was entering Piacenza station. Eight people were killed and some 30 injured.
Under Italian law, individuals suspected of an offence must be notified that they are under investigation. The notification does not mean charges will automatically follow.
